DataElement.preferredName: PedsQL Cancer Module Version 3 N4 Past One Month How Much Feel Too Nauseated to Eat Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much of a problem it has been in the past one month with feeling too nauseous to eat, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Cancer Module Past 30 Days Quantity Feel Too Nauseated to Eat Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A complement to the Pediatric Quality of Life generic core scales designed to provide greater measurement sensitivity for patients with cancer. This module has 25 items comprising 8 dimensions for use with children aged 2 to 18 years._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A question about whether an individual feels too nauseous to eat._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you feel too sick to your
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you feel too sick to your stomach to eat

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
